meanings.definition: Cheat or swindle someone out of something, especially money.
meanings.sent1: He was caught stiffing his friend out of lunch money.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after stiffing the waiter by not leaving a tip.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried stiffing the clever rabbit out of its carrots.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was an expert at stiffing unsuspecting victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved stiffing the audience out of their disbelief.

meanings.definition: To fail to tip or pay someone for a service.
meanings.sent1: They risk stiffing the hardworking delivery person if they don't tip.
meanings.sent2: I always make sure to tip well and avoid stiffing anyone who serves me.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to tip the barber would be like stiffing him of his well-deserved reward.
meanings.sent4: She realized her mistake of stiffing the taxi driver and quickly rectified it.
meanings.sent5: The group decided to pool their money to avoid stiffing the helpful tour guide.

meanings.definition: To make something rigid or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The cold weather was stiffing the branches of the trees.
meanings.sent2: Using too much glue can stiffen the paper, making it hard to fold.
meanings.sent3: The old book had stiffened pages that were difficult to turn.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules were stiffing the creativity of the students.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout stiffened his muscles, making it hard to move.
